title: Week in pictures: 10-16 October 2020
description: A selection of striking images taken around the world this week.

title: Military Wives Choirs and The Hepworth Wakefield get share of £76m fund
description: The cash grants for arts venues and organisations is part of the government's Cultural Recovery Fund.

title: Ammonite: Who was the real Mary Anning?
description: In a romantic Victorian-era drama, Kate Winslet plays the role of fossilist Mary Anning. Who was she?

title: Coronavirus: Lockdown year 'worst ever' for dog thefts
description: Experts say the demand for dogs during lockdown is causing a significant increase in animals being stolen.

title: Azerbaijan at war: Reporter’s journal
description: A BBC team spent a week looking at the Nagorno-Karabakh conflict from the Azerbaijani side.

title: Climate change action sidelined by Covid-19, say young activists
description: More than half of 18 to 24-years-old in the UK are worried that climate change has been neglected because of coronavirus.

title: Covid in the UK: Time to get up to date with the rules
description: It's been a tough week for keeping track of the coronavirus situation in the UK. So what's going on?

title: Covid patients 'less likely to die than in April'
description: Patients admitted to intensive care have a better chance of surviving now than they did in the first wave.

title: Covid: Chris Christie 'was wrong' to not wear masks
description: Chris Christie says he was "wrong" to shun masks after battling Covid-19 in intensive care for days.

title: The Roads: Three men on how they fell into criminality and how they got out
description: Three young men who were lured into drug gangs as children talk about how they turned their lives around.

title: US election: Are white women voters wavering on Trump?
description: Polls suggest they're changing their minds on the president. We look at what impact it could have.

title: Coronavirus: Is there a future for street fundraising?
description: Face-to-face fundraising is vital for charities' cash income - but does it have a post-Covid future?

title: My Money: 'Most of our spending is on our son'
description: Ned Vincent from Norfolk takes us through his week during the coronavirus pandemic.

title: Joshua to defend titles against Pulev in December
description: World heavyweight champion Anthony Joshua will defend his IBF, WBA, WBO and IBO titles against Kubrat Pulev on 12 December at The O2 in London.

title: Manic Street Preachers help disabled singer Ali Hirsz pay for surgery
description: The band donated money to disabled singer Ali Hirsz, after Covid-19 left her out of work.

title: Florida city sells swans after Queen's gift leads to overpopulation
description: Queen Elizabeth II's donation to Lakeland, Florida in 1957 was a gift that kept on giving too much.

title: 'Massive disappointment' in Lancashire over tier 3 move
description: New Covid restrictions in Lancashire are "basically suffocating" trade, one pub boss says.

title: Coronavirus infections still rising rapidly
description: There are an estimated 27,900 new cases a day in England, the Office for National Statistics says.

title: Covid: Lancashire to move to highest alert level
description: The move follows intensive talks, with pubs, bars and car boot sales closing while gyms stay open.

title: Fortnight 'fire-break' in Wales likely within days
description: Wales faces a two-week stay-at-home "fire-break" lockdown, says First Minister Mark Drakeford.

title: County Championship to be revamped with three groups of six
description: The County Championship will return next summer with the 18 first-class counties split into three groups.

title: Covid: Remdesivir 'has little or no effect' on survival, says WHO
description: Drug manufacturer Gilead has questioned the findings, from a clinical study by the WHO.

title: Brexit: UK must 'get ready' for no EU trade deal, says PM
description: Boris Johnson has not walked away from trade talks - but says the EU must change direction to save them.

title: Covid: Andy Burnham holding the government 'over a barrel', says Raab
description: Do "the right thing" and accept tougher rules, the foreign secretary urges Greater Manchester's mayor.

title: Your pictures on the theme of 'life in the water'
description: A selection of pictures from our readers on the theme of "life in the water".

title: British Airways fined £20m over data breach
description: The fine is the largest ever issued by the Information Commissioner's Office.

title: 'I'm sick of influencers asking for free cake'
description: Some small businesses are resisting calls from social media influencers for free gifts.

title: Harry Maguire: Manchester United defender will bounce back from England red card, says Ole Gunnar Solskjaer
description: Manchester United manager Ole Gunnar Solskjaer says captain Harry Maguire will "bounce back" from his recent poor spell of form and England red card.

title: Burrow given Challenge Cup final honour before Leeds face Salford
description: Leeds legend Rob Burrow is named as chief guest "in absentia" for Saturday's Challenge Cup final.

title: Pub chain JD Wetherspoon reveals first loss since 1984
description: Chairman Tim Martin criticises the government's "confusing" Covid restrictions as sales tumble.

title: Coronavirus testing lab 'chaotic and dangerous', scientist claims
description: One experienced virologist raises concerns about safety protocols and a lack of training.

title: Matt Baker to return to The One Show for Rickshaw Challenge
description: The BBC show's former host will take part in the Rickshaw Challenge in aid of Children in Need.

title: Man denied £1.7m payout by Betfred takes fight to High Court
description: Andy Green is suing bookmaker Betfred after it refused to pay up, citing a software error.

title: Disney updates content warning for racism in classic films
description: Films such as Dumbo and Peter Pan now warn of "negative depictions... of people or cultures".

title: 'It was me or him' - Ex-Liverpool youth player admits injuring team-mate in bid for first team
description: Former Liverpool youth team player Tom Brewitt says he once injured a team-mate on purpose in a bid to win a first-team place.

title: Merseyside derby: Watch last time Everton beat Liverpool
description: Relive the action from the last time Everton beat Liverpool in the Premier League when the Toffees won the Merseyside derby 2-0 at Goodison Park in October 2010.

title: 'The next proper challenger' - Everton can rival Liverpool, says Klopp
description: Carlo Ancelotti's Everton can become "the next proper challenger" to Liverpool in the Premier League, says Reds manager Jurgen Klopp.

title: Slow map: Mapping Britain's intercity footpaths
description: A geographer wants to help people find their feet by mapping the best routes to walk between towns.

title: Victoria Wood biography explores her 'painful' childhood
description: The authorised account of the comedian's life reveals the troubled origins of her public genius.
